message.content:
{"id": "41347", 
"title": "Bug 41347: CCombo fires defaultSelection on mouse list selection",
"description": "When using a CCombo, if you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry using the mouse, the defaultSelection event is fired. This behavior is inconsistent with standard Combos and can be confusing for users. The expected behavior is that selecting an entry from the list with the mouse should not trigger the defaultSelection event.", 
"OB": "The OB statement is missing in the bug report.", 
"EB": "The CCombo should not fire the defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the combo list using the mouse. The behavior should be consistent with standard Combos.", 
"SR": "To fix this issue, the code for CCombo should be updated to prevent firing the defaultSelection event when an entry is selected from the combo list using the mouse."}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '41347', 'title': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection", 'description': "Bug 41347CCombo shouldn't fire defaultSelection on mouse list selection It shouldn't do this. A typical user of a combobox would be vert surprised to have thedialog be dismissed just because the entry was selected. ", 'OB': '', 'EB': '', 'SR': "If you drop down the combo list using the mouse and then select an entry usingthe mouse, the CCombo fires a defaultSelection. Standard Combos won'tdo this.Because of this you can't tell the difference between just selecting an entryusing the mouse and hitting enter from the text field of the CCombo. "}
